alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton and northeastern Franklin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burke, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burke, Chateaugay, Malone, Constable, Earlville, Burke Center, and North Burke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton
